member.name: T:SuperSmashPolls.Characters.CharacterManager

The friction of the character

member.name: T:SuperSmashPolls.Characters.MoveAssets
member.summary: Holds and manages the assets needed for every move

member.name: F:SuperSmashPolls.Characters.MoveAssets.Animation
member.summary: The action for this move. This is the animated texture that is drawn to the screen

member.name: F:SuperSmashPolls.Characters.MoveAssets.Sound
member.summary: This is the sound played when this move is done

member.name: F:SuperSmashPolls.Characters.MoveAssets.HitboxVertices
member.summary: These are the vertices to create hitboxes from for the collision bodies. These need to be here so that we don't store the texture and need to re-decompose it every time we need a new body

member.name: F:SuperSmashPolls.Characters.MoveAssets.HitboxBodies
member.summary: These are the bodies for the hitboxes to be generated when a level is being started

member.name: T:SuperSmashPolls.Characters.MoveAssets.MoveFunction
member.summary: This is the type of function that needs to be used as a move
member.param: The current frame of the move
The direction that the character is facing
The bodies in the world that will be affected by this move

member.name: F:SuperSmashPolls.Characters.MoveAssets.Function
member.summary: The function to run when this move is activated

The size of each individual image
The spritesheet to draw as the animation for this move
The scale needed to fit the textures on the screen properly
The texture of the hitboxes for moves. Must be the same image size AND scale as spriteSheet
The function to run when this move is used
Any effects to play when this move is used

The collision category for the player
The categories of objects that these moves should collide with

member.summary: Updates the move of the character
member.param: The direction that the character is facing
The location of the character in the world
if this move should be on the character
member.returns: If the move is done or inturruptable
member.remarks: Drawing for moves is taken care of in the Moves class

member.name: M:SuperSmashPolls.Characters.MoveAssets.GetPosition
member.summary: Gets the position of the current body
member.returns: The position of the current action

member.name: M:SuperSmashPolls.Characters.MoveAssets.FindTouchingBodies
member.summary: Finds the bodies in the world where the current hitbox is colliding with
member.returns: The bodies in the world where the hitbox is colliding with something

members.member:
Creates a list of vertices from a texture.
The texture to make a body from The scale of the texture The size of each individual image in the hitbox The density of the object (Will almost always be one The decomposition algorithm to use Available algorithms to use are Bayazit, Dealuny, Earclip, Flipcode, Seidel, SeidelTrapazoid @warning In order for this to work the input must have a transparent background. I highly reccomend that you only use this with PNGs as that is what I have tested and I know they work. This will only produce a bosy as clean as the texture you give it, so avoid partically transparent areas and little edges.

member.summary: Class for handling character moves. The moves themself must be defined within the MoveDefinition class, than that class passed to here, than the filled class has to be put within its corresponding character.

The background for this level
The amount that the background needs to be scaled (adjusted for different screen sizes)

member.name: M:SuperSmashPolls.Levels.LevelHandler.#ctor(System.String,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Constructor
member.param: The name of this level
The spawn point for player one
The spawn point for player two
The spawn point for player three
The spawn point for player four
The respawn point for all players when/if they die
The gravity of the world on a horizontal scale
The gravity on a vertical scale

members.member:
Creates a polygon from a texture. This is the important function here.
The texture to make a body from The density of the object (Will almost always be one The position (in meters) of the object in the world The scale of the object (how much to change its size) The decomposition algorithm to use Available algorithms to use are Bayazit, Dealuny, Earclip, Flipcode, Seidel, SeidelTrapazoid @warning In order for this to work the input must have a transparent background. I highly reccomend that you only use this with PNGs as that is what I have tested and I know they work. This will only produce a bosy as clean as the texture you give it, so avoid partically transparent areas and little edges.

member.name: M:SuperSmashPolls.Levels.LevelHandler.SetBackground(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Texture2D,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2)
member.summary: Sets a background to the level
member.param: The texture to use as a background
The scale to use for the background texture (i.e. background is 640x360, screen is 1280x720 we would need to scale by 2)

member.name: M:SuperSmashPolls.Levels.LevelHandler.AssignToWorld(System.Tuple{Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Texture2D,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2}[])
member.summary: Creates the body and puts it in the world
member.param: All the items to add to the world (Texture, position (meters), size (meters))

member.summary: This draws world

members.member:
Holds the different commands that the menu might need to send into the main game. There should be one of these for everthing the menu is supposed to do.
This is a somewhat kluge solution, but it works well ****************************************************************************************************************

member.name: T:SuperSmashPolls.MenuControl.MenuItem
member.summary: This class handles all properties of an item on a menu. One very important object is the void function reference to be ran when the item is selected. This function needs to be declared and defined elsewhere, and when the item is constructed it must be passed as an argument.
member.remarks: To create multi-leveled menus you must construct items from bottom to top.

members.member: Position of this item on the screen
Buffer to move text over from Position
If the item has it's own menu that it can display if selected
Whether or not to play the audio of the item above it
The position of characters for American Text mode
Font to use for this item
Texture to use as the thumbnail for this item
The size of this item (as a ratio of the picture's size)
Background for this menu item (if the item is selected). This will cover the entire screen @warning This must be set during load content
Overlay this item's sub-menu on top of the current menu TODO impliment
The music for this menu
Handles looping of audio

member.name: F:SuperSmashPolls.MenuControl.MenuItem.Highlightable
member.summary: Determines if the item is highlihtable or not. Highlightable items can be selected

member.name: F:SuperSmashPolls.MenuControl.MenuItem.CenterItem

members.member:
Adds options to a submenu. Options can only be added once, otherwise the previously added options will be overriden.
The first string is the key to display on the menu as the title for the option, the second are the values to associate to that option. TODO allow ranges of numbers

member.name: M:SuperSmashPolls.Game1.Initialize
member.summary: Allows the game to perform any initialization it needs to before starting to run. This is where it can query for any required services and load any non-graphic related content. Calling base. Initialize will enumerate through any components and initialize them as well.

member.name: M:SuperSmashPolls.Game1.LoadContent
member.summary: LoadContent will be called once per game and is the place to load all of your content.

member.name: M:SuperSmashPolls.Game1.UnloadContent
member.summary: UnloadContent will be called once per game and is the place to unload all content.

member.name: T:SuperSmashPolls.World_Control.WorldUnit
member.summary: This class will account for scaling of the physics system based on the size of the player's screen size.
member.remarks: WorldUnit should replace position and force/weight references throughout the rest of the game.
0.01F unit of position is equal to 1% of the screen.
1.0F of GodForce = ScreenSize * 10 | 0.1 of GodForce = ScreenSize
To use this class to determine the size of something use the position functions

member.name: M:SuperSmashPolls.World_Control.WorldUnit.#ctor(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2)
member.summary: Construct a WorldUnit class for use as a position.
member.param: Reference to the size of the players screen (in pixels)
Position of the unit on screen as a float
member.remarks: Doing it like this allows for the screensize to be changed without messing up physics.

member.name: M:SuperSmashPolls.World_Control.WorldUnit.#ctor(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2,SuperSmashPolls.World_Control.WorldUnit)
member.summary: Construct a WorldUnit class based off the same scales as another WorldUnit for use as a position.
member.param: The position of this object on the screen (as a ratio)
The scale to base this new WorldUnit off of.

member.name: M:SuperSmashPolls.World_Control.WorldUnit.GetThisPosition
member.summary: Gets this item's position on the screen

member.name: M:SuperSmashPolls.World_Control.WorldUnit.Add(SuperSmashPolls.World_Control.WorldUnit)
member.summary: Adds two WorldUnits for a new WorldUnit

member.name: M:SuperSmashPolls.World_Control.WorldUnit.GetSize
member.summary: Gets the size of this object
member.remarks: This is identical to GetThisPosition(), but it is easier to understand like this.

member.name: M:SuperSmashPolls.World_Control.WorldUnit.GetXSize
member.summary: Gets the size of this object's X axis (the amount it is from (0,0))

member.name: M:SuperSmashPolls.World_Control.WorldUnit.GetYSize
member.summary: Gets the size of this object's Y axis (the amount it is from (0,0))
